pl.cnf

Class Clause

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<E>
        • pl.util.ArraySet<Literal>
          • pl.cnf.Clause
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Literal>, java.util.Collection<Literal>, java.util.Set<Literal>

    public class Clause
extends ArraySet<Literal>
    A clause is a disjunction of literals. We represent it as a set for ease of use later.

    Note that the current implementation of this class extends ArraySet, which itself extends AbstractSet, which overrides Object.equals(java.lang.Object) and Object.hashCode() (with AbstractSet#equals and Abstract#hashCode, respectively). Thus we do not need to provide implementations of those methods ourselves (but if we did, we would need to remember that the hash code of a set is defined to be the sum of the hash codes of the elements in the set.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class pl.util.ArraySet

        elements

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Clause(Sentence s)
      Return a new Clause constructed from the given Sentence, which must be a disjunction of literals (i.e., an AtomicSentence, the negation of an AtomicSentence, or a BinaryCompoundSentence whose connective is OR in which case its arguments must be disjunctions of literals.

      • isSatisfiedBy

        public boolean isSatisfiedBy(Model model)
        Return true if this Clause is satisfied by the given Model. That is, if each of its Literals is satisfied by the Model.
